items.sentence: Who\'ll stay with your children while you\'re out working?
Have you told everyone when and where the meeting will be?
I could tell you things about Tom that would surprise you.
Tom told Mary that she could do whatever she wanted to do.
What do you spend most of your time on the computer doing?
I saw Mary sitting in front of a mirror brushing her hair.
Tom doesn\'t seem to understand what he\'s supposed to do.
Tom doesn\'t have to tell me anything he doesn\'t want to.
You shouldn\'t respect someone just because they\'re rich.
Tom asked Mary to teach him some useful phrases in French.
Whether we do that or not depends onÂ what Tom wants to do.
Tom doesn\'t know who Mary is planning on doing that with.
Tom doesn\'t know why Mary needs to borrow thirty dollars.
Tom doesn\'t really expect me to be at his party, does he?
Last week\'s storm damaged many trees in our neighborhood.
Let\'s get a picture of us with the sea in the background.
Let\'s look at the problem from a different point of view.
I think Tom\'s grandmother is too old to wear a miniskirt.
I think it must\'ve happened just the way Tom said it did.
I think it\'s time for me to discuss the problem with her.
It looked like you didn\'t want to do what you were doing.
It might be more difficult to do than you think it\'ll be.
I heard a man\'s voice and thought it sounded like Tom\'s.
Tom hoped Mary wouldn\'t find out about what had happened.
I think that I have a right to know what\'s going on here.
I think there\'s still a chance Tom will get here on time.
I hate to bother you, but would you mind closing the door?
I know that it is highly unlikely that anyone can help me.
I laughed when Tom told me he was planning to get married.
It\'s about time someone did something about that problem.
It\'s been three years since Tom started working for Mary.
Tom has been studying at Harvard for the last three years.
Tom is having trouble coping with the high cost of living.
I don\'t like being made to do things I don\'t want to do.
The kidnappers gagged Tom and locked him up in the closet.
Tom says he\'ll sing that song he wrote about you tonight.
Tom says it\'s a waste of time to try to please everybody.
Tom says that he can\'t imagine going out in this weather.
Tom stood perfectly still, hoping he wouldn\'t be noticed.
Mary wanted to finish making breakfast before Tom woke up.
You\'re a good student, but you still have a lot to learn.
You\'re going to have to do better to convince me of that.
Are you having any difficulty breathing through your nose?
We have to learn all the songs before the end of the week.
Tom told me that he doesn\'t have any brothers or sisters.
I haven\'t been back here since that unfortunate incident.
Tom is the only one in our family who can\'t speak French.
Tom couldn\'t understand why Mary was acting so strangely.
Tom didn\'t decide to become a writer until he was thirty.
Tom didn\'t even have enough money to buy a cup of coffee.
